projects.title: Personal Branding Engine & Dynamic CMS
projects.description:
A high-performance, database-driven portfolio application engineered to showcase technical projects and professional experience. This project serves as a 'Meta-Project', demonstrating the ability to build, deploy, and maintain a live web application with a dynamic backend and automated data persistence.

KEY ENGINEERING CONTRIBUTIONS
1. Dual-Environment Database Architecture
‚Ä¢ Hybrid Storage: Developed a flexible configuration system that utilizes SQLite for rapid local development and PostgreSQL for scalable production on Render.
‚Ä¢ ORM Layer: Implemented SQLAlchemy to abstract database interactions, allowing for seamless migrations and complex relational queries without writing raw SQL.

2. Dynamic Content Management (CMS)
‚Ä¢ Relational Schema: Architected a relational database to handle one-to-many relationships between projects, technology tags, and user experiences.
‚Ä¢ Template Logic: Used Jinja2 to build reusable components, ensuring that adding a new project to the database automatically updates the UI, the category filters, and the project detail pages without touching the HTML.

3. Frontend Excellence & Responsive UX
‚Ä¢ Bootstrap 5 Integration: Designed a mobile-first UI using Bootstrap 5 grid systems and utility classes for a clean, professional aesthetic.
‚Ä¢ Interactive Components: Leveraged JavaScript for reactive UI elements, such as dynamic project filtering and hover-state overlays.

CORE FUNCTIONALITY
Feature & Implementation

1. Backend Framework: Flask with Blueprints for organized, modular routing.
2. Persistence: SQLite (Dev) / PostgreSQL (Prod) via SQLAlchemy ORM.
3. Styling: Custom CSS3 and Bootstrap 5 for high-fidelity responsive design.
4. Deployment: CI/CD pipeline integrated with GitHub and Render.
5. Environment Control: Secure handling of API keys and DB URLs via .env files.
projects.technologies: Python (Flask), PostgreSQL, SQLite, SQLAlchemy, Bootstrap 5, Jinja2, Render

projects.title: ElectiSync ‚Äì Election Analytics & Result Management System (Bincom Test
projects.description:
ElectiSync is an interactive data management system developed to provide transparent access to regional election results. The project features a robust backend for database migration and a clean, tabbed interface for data visualization and entry. It addresses a core engineering challenge: migrating legacy MySQL datasets into a localized SQLite environment for rapid analysis and reporting.

KEY ENGINEERING CONTRIBUTIONS 
1. Automated Database Migration Pipeline
I engineered a custom migration script in _init_.py to handle cross-engine database compatibility:
‚Ä¢ Legacy SQL Sanitization: Developed a Regex-powered cleaning engine to strip MySQL-specific headers (e.g., ENGINE, AUTO_INCREMENT) that would otherwise crash an SQLite instance.
‚Ä¢ Streamlined Initialization: Implemented an automated setup process that reads raw SQL dumps and builds a high-integrity .db file in seconds using cursor.executescript.

2. Multi-Level Result Analysis (Relational Logic)
‚Ä¢ Hierarchical Queries: Architected complex SQL joins to aggregate scores from individual Polling Units (PUs) up to the Local Government Area (LGA) level.
‚Ä¢ SQL Injection Prevention: Implemented secure, parameterized queries across the model layer to ensure data security during user-driven data fetching.
‚Ä¢ Dataframe Integration: Leveraged Pandas to bridge the gap between raw SQL results and Streamlit's UI, enabling high-speed table rendering and reactive data charts.

3. Data Persistence & Integrity
‚Ä¢ Dynamic Result Entry: Built a secure 'Store Results' portal using Streamlit Forms, featuring automated ID generation and timestamping.
‚Ä¢ Audit Trail Logic: Developed a verification system to display real-time database activity, allowing administrators to track the most recent five entries for data validation.

CORE FUNCTIONALITY
Feature & Implementation
1. Migration Engine: Automated MySQL-to-SQLite conversion via Regex cleaning.
2. Polling Unit Result Viewer: Individual polling unit tracking with bar chart visualization.
3. LGA Aggregator: Real-time score summation across multiple regional units.
4. Secure Submission: Validated form-based entry for new election records.
5. Audit Log: Real-time display of recent database transactions.
